most_active_tickets.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Failing to Launch
common_issues.description: Users are reporting that the Pieces Desktop Application is failing to launch on both Windows and MacOS.  The error message "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect" is observed. Rebooting and reinstalling the application have not resolved the issue.  The Pieces team is actively investigating.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** SherlockSol reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol described the issue and provided some details about their environment.
* The bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop is not launching on SherlockSol's Windows PC.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions were proposed or implemented in this conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been routed to the proper Pieces team member, who will follow up within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is similar to other reported issues with Pieces Desktop not launching on Windows.
* SherlockSol is encouraged to review the suggested resources for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `seantiz` encountered a bug where files weren't loading into the context after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses.
* The user is unable to reproduce the issue on their end.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files are not loading into the context despite receiving responses.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue has been triaged and routed to the relevant Pieces team member.
* The user has been provided with links to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the issue.
* No further updates are available at this time.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of "Invalid Port" bug:** This issue is affecting multiple users on both Windows and MacOS, hindering their ability to launch the application. Allocate resources to investigate and resolve this critical bug urgently.

**Improve error messaging:** The error message "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect" is not user-friendly. Provide clearer error messages with potential solutions to help users troubleshoot the issue.

**Investigate potential antivirus conflicts:** Some users suspect antivirus software might be interfering with the application launch. Investigate potential conflicts and provide guidance on configuring antivirus settings.

**Review and enhance chatbot responses:** The chatbot response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible" is reported as unhelpful. Train the chatbot to provide more actionable responses, suggest relevant resources, or escalate to human support when necessary.

**Improve documentation and knowledge base:** Ensure the documentation and knowledge base include troubleshooting steps for common issues, including the "Invalid Port" error and potential antivirus conflicts. Make it easy for users to find answers to their questions independently.
